snippet: Most of those who have landed this year are entitled to be resettled as refugees under international law, the United Nations said.
abstract: United Nations refugee agency reports that record 137,000 people have crossed Mediterranean Sea in search of better life in Europe so far in 2015; figure represents an 83 percent increase from 2014, and highlights growing refugee crisis.
lead_paragraph: Most of those who have landed this year are entitled to be resettled as refugees under international law, the United Nations said.

headline.main: Record Number of Refugees Crossing to Europe, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: Record Number of Migrants Crossing to Europe, U.N. Says

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations High Commission for Refugees
